intro: Achyronia myrtillifolia, commonly known as the myrtle-leaved achyronia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in summer. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along streams. Its botanical features make it an important component of its native ecosystem.
